intro: Matthiola tristis var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and profuse display of violet to purple flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring and has narrow, linear leaves that are slightly hairy. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
